meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Megan Johnson Elaine Ricci Joon Pahk Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6217.

td.p: Megan Johnson, an attorney originally from Toledo, Ohio
Elaine Ricci, a tutor and substitute teacher from Houston, Texas
Joon Pahk, a college physics teacher from Somerville, Massachusetts (whose 1-day cash winnings total $28,800)

tr.td: METALS
THE STAN LEE CUP
THEY OUGHT TO MAKE A MOVIE
DOUBLE "D"
A STICKY SITUATION
(Karine Vanasse: On the new series Pan Am we portray the greatest era of a great airline--Pan Am in the '60s.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Mines near Santiago & in the Atacama Desert make this country the world\'s leading copper producer')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Mines near Santiago & in the Atacama Desert make this country the world's leading copper producer

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'He crawled out of Stan\'s head for "Amazing Fantasy" in 1962 before "spinning" off into his own comic book')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: He crawled out of Stan's head for "Amazing Fantasy" in 1962 before "spinning" off into his own comic book

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', 'For Michael Korda\'s "Ike", a biography of this man, I\'m thinking Brendan Fraser')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(I\'m Christina Ricci.) Our show has set scenes at this airport that got its present name in 1963; it was one of the first to give airlines their own terminals, with Pan Am\'s being one of the most modern')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (I'm Christina Ricci.) Our show has set scenes at this airport that got its present name in 1963; it was one of the first to give airlines their own terminals, with Pan Am's being one of the most modern

In our show I appear on the cover of Life; in 1968 Pan Am flight attendant Susan Sicari really did make the cover along with the Aeroflot counterpart as Pan Am began the 1st regular air link with this Cold War capital')

tr.td: Joon
Elaine

(lock game)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [*], Admiral Nelson\'s column there.)
[Elaine had a mark written after the S which appeared to be the beginning of a q, but was not sufficiently complete to be sure, and was ruled incorrect by the judges after Alex initially appeared ready to accept it as correct.]
MeganWhat is Trafalgar Square.
$8,999
ElaineWhat is Trafalgar S.
$10,600
JoonWhat is Trafalgar Sq.?
$12,000
Trafalgar Square')
